caption:
This photograph captures a close-up, side profile of a man with a distinct rugged appearance. He wears a wide-brimmed, weathered hat and has a full, bushy beard and mustache, both of which are graying. His long hair is pulled back, showing signs of gray, and peeks from beneath his hat. He is dressed in a denim or similarly textured gray shirt, contributing to his overall rustic, outdoorsy look.

The man's expression is serene, with his eyes closed and mouth slightly opened, suggesting a moment of relaxation or contemplation. The background is a simple, unobtrusive brick wall that provides a clean and undistracted backdrop, emphasizing the subject of the photograph.

Overall, the photograph has a warm, natural color palette, dominated by the earthy tones of the man's attire and the red brick background, evoking a sense of calm and timeless character.
title: Bob Breeze, a local historian known as "Wolf River Bob," shown attending an auction of school artifacts at White Cloud, Kansas, near Troy. Proceeds of the auction went to the Ma Hush Ka (White Cloud) Historical Society for their local museum housed in the schoolhouse. Some people would like to see White Cloud restored as an example of a 19th-century Kansas River town.
